original_excerpt: Io ritornai da la santissima onda\\rifatto s\`{\i} come piante novelle\\rinnovellate di novella fronda,\\puro e disposto a salire alle stelle.
Cary_excerpt: I return'd\\From the most holy wave, regenerate,\\If 'en as new plants renew'd with foliage new,\\Pure and made apt for mounting to the stars. …

original_excerpt: ...se la mente tua ben sé riguarda,\\non mi ti celerà l’esser più bella,
Cary_excerpt: ...if thy mind observe me well, this form,\\With such addition grac'd of loveliness,\\Will not conceal me long, …

original_excerpt: s\`{\i} vid’io ben più di mille splendori\\trarsi ver’ noi, e in ciascun s’ud\`{\i}a:
Cary_excerpt: ..so drew\\Full more than thousand splendours towards us, …

original_excerpt: … «Il mondo m’ebbe\\giù poco tempo; e se più fosse stato,\\molto sarà di mal, che non sarebbe.
Cary_excerpt: \textquotesingle A short date below\\The world possess'd me. Had the time been more,\\Much evil, that will come, had never chanc'd. …

original_excerpt: a rotar cominciò la santa mola;\\e nel suo giro tutta non si volse\\prima ch’un’altra di cerchio la chiuse,
Cary_excerpt: ...straight the holy mill\\Began to wheel, nor yet had once revolv'd,\\Or ere another, circling, compass'd it,

original_excerpt: ...con tanto lucore e tanto robbi\\m’apparvero splendor dentro a due raggi,
Cary_excerpt: ...With such mighty sheen\\And mantling crimson, in two listed rays\\The splendours shot before me,

original_excerpt: ...quella croce lampeggiava Cristo,
Cary_excerpt: …Christ\\Beam'd on that cross; ...

original_excerpt: ...conveniesi a quella pietra scema\\che guarda ’l ponte, che Fiorenza fesse\\vittima ne la sua pace postrema.
Cary_excerpt: ...so was doom'd:\\On that maim'd stone set up to guard the bridge,\\At thy last peace, the victim, Florence! fell.

original_excerpt: resurger parver quindi più di mille\\luci e salir, …
Cary_excerpt: Thus more than thousand twinkling lustres hence\\Seem'd reascending, …

original_excerpt: O milizia del ciel cu’ io contemplo,\\adora per color che sono in terra\\tutti sviati dietro al malo essemplo!
Cary_excerpt: Ye host of heaven! whose glory I survey!\\O beg ye grace for those, that are on earth\\All after ill example gone astray.

original_excerpt: Parea dinanzi a me con l’ali aperte\\la bella image che nel dolce frui\\liete facevan l’anime conserte;
Cary_excerpt: Before my sight appear'd, with open wings,\\The beauteous image, in fruition sweet\\Gladdening the thronged spirits. …

original_excerpt: tal mi sembi\`o l’imago de la ’mprenta\\de l’etterno piacere, al cui disio\\ciascuna cosa qual ell’è diventa.
Cary_excerpt: ...such appear'd\\That image stampt by the' everlasting pleasure,\\Which fashions like itself all lovely things.

original_excerpt: Già eran li occhi miei rifissi al volto\\de la mia donna, e l’animo con essi,\\e da ogne altro intento s’era tolto.
Cary_excerpt: Again mine eyes were fix'd on Beatrice,\\And with mine eyes my soul, that in her looks\\Found all contentment. …

original_excerpt: di color d’oro in che raggio traluce\\vid’io uno scaleo eretto in suso\\tanto, che nol seguiva la mia luce.
Cary_excerpt: ...I saw rear'd up,\\In colour like to sun-illumin'd gold.\\A ladder, which my ken pursued in vain,\\So lofty was the summit; ...

original_excerpt: Comincia dunque; e di’ ove s’appunta\\l’anima tua, …
Cary_excerpt: ...Say then,\\Beginning, to what point thy soul aspires:

original_excerpt: ...m’inebriava il dolce canto.\\Ci\`o ch’io vedeva mi sembiava un riso\\de l’universo; per che mia ebbrezza\\intrava per l’udire e per lo viso.
Cary_excerpt: ...with the song\\My spirit reel'd, so passing sweet the strain:\\And what I saw was equal ecstasy;

original_excerpt: L’incendio suo seguiva ogne scintilla;\\ed eran tante, che ’l numero loro\\più che ’l doppiar de li scacchi s’inmilla.
Cary_excerpt: ...every sparkle shivering to new blaze,\\In number did outmillion the account\\Reduplicate upon the chequer'd board.

original_excerpt: In forma dunque di candida rosa\\mi si mostrava la milizia santa
Cary_excerpt: In fashion, as a snow-white rose, lay then\\Before my view the saintly multitude,

original_excerpt: Vidi a lor giochi quivi e a lor canti\\ridere una bellezza, che letizia\\era ne li occhi a tutti li altri santi;
Cary_excerpt: ...At their glee\\And carol, smil' d the Lovely One of heav'n,\\That joy was in the eyes of all the blest.
